entry.title: Delta-type glutamate receptors are ligand-gated ion channels
entry.content:
Delta-type glutamate receptors are ligand-gated ion channels

entry.title: Continuous operation of a coherent 3,000-qubit system
entry.content:
Continuous operation of a coherent 3,000-qubit system

  • Neng-Chun Chiu

entry.title: Long-range PM2.5 pollution and health impacts from the 2023 Canadian wildfires
entry.content:
Long-range PM2.5 pollution and health impacts from the 2023 Canadian wildfires

A modelling study based on satellite observations, machine learning and a chemical transport model quantifies the global and regional exposure to particulate-matter pollution and the human health impacts related to the 2023 Canadian wildfires.

  • Qiang Zhang
  • Yuexuanzi Wang
  • Kebin He
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: The oldest known lepidosaur and origins of lepidosaur feeding adaptations
entry.content:
The oldest known lepidosaur and origins of lepidosaur feeding adaptations

A rhynchocephalian skeleton around 3–7 million years older than the oldest currently known lepidosaur fossil provides important insight into the origin of lizards and snakes.

  • Daniel Marke
  • David I. Whiteside
  • Michael J. Benton
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Human gastroids to model regional patterning in early stomach development
entry.content:
Human gastroids to model regional patterning in early stomach development

Neural tissue is a key signalling centre for fundic–antral patterning in development of gastric organoids featuring asymmetric PDX1 patterning.

  • Xia Li
  • Feng Lin
  • Yue Shao
Article10 Sept 2025

entry.title: The emergence of globular clusters and globular-cluster-like dwarfs
entry.content:
The emergence of globular clusters and globular-cluster-like dwarfs

The results from a state-of-the-art suite of hydrodynamical cosmological zoom-in simulations show how globular clusters naturally emerge in the Standard Cosmology and also reveal the existence of a new class of object called globular-cluster-like dwarfs.

  • Ethan D. Taylor
  • Justin I. Read
  • Robert M. Yates
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Programmable antisense oligomers for phage functional genomics
entry.content:
Programmable antisense oligomers for phage functional genomics

Establishing antisense oligomers as versatile, non-genetic tools to silence phage mRNAs opens applications in basic research and biotechnology, as shown by identifying essential factors for propagation of the nucleus-forming jumbo phage ΦKZ such as the RNase H-like protein ΦKZ155.

  • Milan Gerovac
  • Leandro Buhlmann
  • Jörg Vogel
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Stabilizing effect of amino acids on protein and colloidal dispersions
entry.content:
Stabilizing effect of amino acids on protein and colloidal dispersions

Amino acids possess a new and broad colloidal property: they stabilize patchy nanoscale colloids, such as proteins, by adsorbing onto their surfaces through weak interactions.

  • Ting Mao
  • Xufeng Xu
  • Francesco Stellacci
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Fluctuating DNA methylation tracks cancer evolution at clinical scale
entry.content:
Fluctuating DNA methylation tracks cancer evolution at clinical scale

Cancer evolutionary dynamics are quantitatively inferred using a method, EVOFLUx, applied to fluctuating DNA methylation.

  • Calum Gabbutt
  • Martí Duran-Ferrer
  • Trevor A. Graham
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Loss-of-function mutations in PLD4 lead to systemic lupus erythematosus
entry.content:
Loss-of-function mutations in PLD4 lead to systemic lupus erythematosus

PLD4 loss-of-function mutations in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus leads to excessive activation of TLR7 and TLR9.

  • Qintao Wang
  • Honghao Zhu
  • Zhihong Liu
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Amplifying antigen-induced cellular responses with proximity labelling
entry.content:
Amplifying antigen-induced cellular responses with proximity labelling

Red light- or ultrasound-controlled proximity labelling is engineered to stimulate clustering-induced receptor activation and downstream signalling amplification to promote antitumour immune responses.

  • Shuojun Li
  • Yinghui Men
  • Shuo Han
Article10 Sept 2025

entry.title: ABCA7 variants impact phosphatidylcholine and mitochondria in neurons
entry.content:
ABCA7 variants impact phosphatidylcholine and mitochondria in neurons

Loss-of-function variants of ABCA7, associated with Alzheimer’s disease, result in disrupted lipid metabolism, mitochondrial function, DNA repair and synaptic signalling pathways in the human brain.

  • Djuna von Maydell
  • Shannon E. Wright
  • Li-Huei Tsai
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Neuronal activity-dependent mechanisms of small cell lung cancer pathogenesis
entry.content:
Neuronal activity-dependent mechanisms of small cell lung cancer pathogenesis

Glutamatergic and GABAergic (γ-aminobutyric acid-producing) cortical neuronal activity drives proliferation of small lung cell cancer via paracrine interactions and through synapses formed with tumour cells.

  • Solomiia Savchuk
  • Kaylee M. Gentry
  • Humsa S. Venkatesh
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Late fluid flow in a primitive asteroid revealed by Lu–Hf isotopes in Ryugu
entry.content:
Late fluid flow in a primitive asteroid revealed by Lu–Hf isotopes in Ryugu

Analysis of samples from the asteroid Ryugu provide evidence of late fluid flow in a carbonaceous asteroid, indicating that such bodies may have retained two to three times more water than previously thought.

  • Tsuyoshi Iizuka
  • Takazo Shibuya
  • Hisayoshi Yurimoto
Article10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Molecular subtypes of human skeletal muscle in cancer cachexia
entry.content:
Molecular subtypes of human skeletal muscle in cancer cachexia

Unbiased clustering analysis of the skeletal muscle RNAome in patients with cancer identifies two molecular subtypes, one of which distinguishes individuals with cachexia and indicates potential target pathways for future research.

  • Bhumi J. Bhatt
  • Sunita Ghosh
  • Sambasivarao Damaraju
Article10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Observing differential spin currents by resonant inelastic X-ray scattering
entry.content:
Observing differential spin currents by resonant inelastic X-ray scattering

Resonant inelastic X-ray scattering can be used to measure the spin current carried by magnons in the presence of temperature gradients across a magnetic insulator.

  • Yanhong Gu
  • Joseph Barker
  • Valentina Bisogni
Article10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Energy deficiency selects crowded live epithelial cells for extrusion
entry.content:
Energy deficiency selects crowded live epithelial cells for extrusion

Crowded epithelial cells with the least energy and membrane potential are selected for extrusion.

  • Saranne J. Mitchell
  • Carlos Pardo-Pastor
  • Jody Rosenblatt
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Systematic attribution of heatwaves to the emissions of carbon majors
entry.content:
Systematic attribution of heatwaves to the emissions of carbon majors

Climate change made 213 historical heatwaves reported over 2000–2023 more likely and more intense, to which each of the 180 carbon majors (fossil fuel and cement producers) substantially contributed.

  • Yann Quilcaille
  • Lukas Gudmundsson
  • Sonia I. Seneviratne
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Redox-driven mineral and organic associations in Jezero Crater, Mars
entry.content:
Redox-driven mineral and organic associations in Jezero Crater, Mars

A geological, petrographic and geochemical survey of distinctive mudstone and conglomerate outcrops of the Bright Angel formation on Mars reveals textures, chemical and mineral characteristics, and organic signatures that warrant consideration as potential biosignatures.

  • Joel A. Hurowitz
  • M. M. Tice
  • Z. U. Wolf
ArticleOpen Access10 Sept 2025

entry.title: Myeloid progenitor dysregulation fuels immunosuppressive macrophages in tumours
entry.content:
Myeloid progenitor dysregulation fuels immunosuppressive macrophages in tumours

An understanding of the molecular mechanisms promoting the generation of immunoregulatory and tumour-promoting monocytes and macrophages is key to breaking the cycle of tumour myelopoiesis and developing more effective myeloid-targeting therapies.

  • Samarth Hegde
  • Bruno Giotti
  • Miriam Merad
Article10 Sept 2025
